intro: Noccaea ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has basal leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or yellowish powder. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in dry, open habitats. Noccaea ochroleuca is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environments.
